learnCards.title: What Are Payment Systems?
learnCards.content:
Payment systems are networks and processes that enable the transfer of money between individuals, businesses, and financial institutions.

They form the backbone of banking operations — ensuring secure, timely, and traceable settlement of funds.

learnCards.title: Types of Payment Systems
learnCards.content:
Banking operations rely on multiple payment rails:
 * RTGS: Real-time settlement for high-value transactions.
 * NEFT: Batch-based fund transfers processed in half-hourly cycles.
 * IMPS: Instant 24x7 retail transfers.
 * UPI: Unified Payments Interface for mobile and QR-based instant payments.

learnCards.title: RTGS – Real Time Gross Settlement
learnCards.content:
Used for large-value transfers (≥ ₹2 lakh) settled instantly on a one-to-one basis.

RTGS ensures final and irrevocable settlement, typically used by corporates, banks, and institutions for high-value clearing.

learnCards.title: NEFT – National Electronic Funds Transfer
learnCards.content:
NEFT operates on a deferred net settlement model, processing transactions in batches every 30 minutes.

It’s ideal for retail and business payments where instant settlement isn’t critical.

learnCards.title: IMPS – Immediate Payment Service
learnCards.content:
IMPS provides instant, 24x7 fund transfers through banks and mobile channels.

Unlike NEFT or RTGS, IMPS works even on holidays, enabling seamless person-to-person and person-to-merchant payments.

learnCards.title: UPI – Unified Payments Interface
learnCards.content:
UPI revolutionized retail payments by allowing real-time fund transfers via mobile apps using a Virtual Payment Address (VPA).

It combines IMPS infrastructure with a simple user experience — QR codes, phone numbers, and handles like @oksbi.

learnCards.title: Clearing and Settlement
learnCards.content:
Clearing refers to the exchange of payment instructions between banks, while settlement is the actual transfer of funds.

Systems like RTGS provide real-time settlement, whereas NEFT and cheque clearing use net settlement cycles.

learnCards.title: Role of NPCI
learnCards.content:
The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) operates major retail payment systems — UPI, IMPS, RuPay, and AePS.

NPCI ensures interoperability, standardization, and innovation across India’s digital payments ecosystem.

learnCards.title: Security & Compliance
learnCards.content:
All payment systems must comply with RBI guidelines, PCI-DSS standards, and strong authentication (2FA).

Banks use encryption, fraud monitoring, and transaction limits to safeguard users and prevent misuse.

learnCards.title: Future Trends in Payments
learnCards.content:
Emerging areas include CBDCs (Central Bank Digital Currency), tokenization, AI-driven fraud detection, and cross-border UPI links.

The focus is on interoperability, instant settlement, and embedded finance experiences.
